column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make Your Polyvore Set Popular
#Text=Polyvore is a popular website that allows you to create collages ( or sets ) that fall into one of four categories : fashion , beauty , home , or art & expression .
#Text=This guide tells you how to promote your set once it has been published , so that you can get lots of views , comments and favorites .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Put lots of effort into creating your set .
#Text=The better it is , the easier it will be to promote .
#Text=Submit your set to the max of five groups .
#Text=In choosing the groups :
#Text=Make sure they are relevant .
#Text=Try to choose a mixture of specialised groups , for example , punk , and general groups , everyone on Polyvore .
#Text=Choose semi-popular groups with a few hundred members ; it they 're too unpopular , no one will ever check the page .
#Text=Equally though , if they 're too popular , your set will be knocked off the ' recent sets ' section too quickly .
#Text=Change the groups that your set is submitted to regularly .
#Text=Change it perhaps every two-four weeks .
#Text=Optionally , you can create your own group and invite lots of people to join it .
#Text=Submit your set to as many different contests as possible .
#Text=Make sure you have a lot of contacts .
#Text=Comment regularly on other peoples sets ( contacts or not ) , this makes it is very likely they will comment back on yours and is the best way of attracting interest .
#Text=Add hash tags .
#Text=When you make your set , put # ( hash tags ) on them so when people search for the relevant word , your set/collection/group will come up .
#Text=For example , if your set has a day dress in it put #daydress .
#Text=Make such it relates to your set .
#Text=Add tag lists of people .
#Text=Add someone like @shans10 , for example .
#Text=Then that person will see your set , thank you for the tag and look on your wall .
#Text=People may then tag you back !
#Text=Make your sets visually appealing and unique .
#Text=For example , do n't make an outfit with a bland t-shirt and skinny jeans .
#Text=Polyvore is used to be creative , not show what you wear every day .
#Text=Let 's be honest , those sets with items far apart , photographs that are n't incorporated well , and overused ( and ugly ) fonts and background colors are eyesores .
#Text=Use only photographs with muted colors in the background to make it visually appealing but not distracting , and try using newspaper articles and quotes to make it look cool .
#Text=When you are n't putting anything in the background , try to organize your items so that they fit well together , like pieces of a puzzle .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Success on Polyvore is n't everything .
#Text=Having fun is a better goal .
#Text=Give your best , Polyvore fans would love to see you try your all , have fun during the process !
#Text=Basically just add a lot of hashtags and you will get likes in just a couple of minutes or hours depending on how good and how much effort you have put to your items/outfits .
#Text=Follow other people and like their sets .
#Text=In return , they 'll follow you and like your sets back !
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't comment only on very popular sets .
#Text=If they 're getting dozens every day , they probably wo n't bother looking at every one .
